cards.name: Highcliff Felidar
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Highcliff Felidar enters the battlefield, for each opponent, choose a creature with the greatest power among creatures that player controls. Destroy those creatures.
cards.flavorText: Once the felidar has marked you as prey, there's no point in running.

cards.name: Sphinx of Enlightenment
cards.text:
Flying
When Sphinx of Enlightenment enters the battlefield, target opponent draws a card and you draw three cards.
cards.flavorText: "I would be a fool if I taught you everything I know."

cards.name: Calculating Lich
cards.text:
Menace
Whenever a creature attacks one of your opponents, that player loses 1 life.
cards.flavorText: "We share a common enemy. Does that not make us friends?"

cards.name: Fiendish Duo
cards.text:
First strike
If a source would deal damage to an opponent, it deals double that damage to that player instead.
cards.flavorText: Half the size, double the mayhem.

cards.name: Earthshaker Giant
cards.text:
Trample
When Earthshaker Giant enters the battlefield, other creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: "Come, my wild children. Let's give the interlopers a woodland welcome."

cards.name: Consul's Lieutenant
cards.text:
First strike
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
Whenever Consul's Lieutenant attacks, if it's renowned, other attacking creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Renown won’t trigger when a creature deals combat damage to a planeswalker or another creature. It also won’t trigger when a creature deals noncombat damage to a player.
If a creature with renown deals combat damage to its controller because that damage was redirected, renown will trigger.

If a renown ability triggers, but the creature leaves the battlefield before that ability resolves, the creature doesn’t become renowned. Any ability that triggers “whenever a creature becomes renowned” won’t trigger.

cards.name: Fiend Binder
cards.text: Whenever Fiend Binder attacks, tap target creature defending player controls.
cards.flavorText: She had not believed any shred of humanity remained in these writhing monsters until the twisted form of her partner appeared before her.

rulings.text: In a multiplayer game, Fiend Binder’s triggered ability can only target a creature controlled by the player it’s attacking (or by the controller of the planeswalker it’s attacking).

cards.name: Kytheon's Irregulars
cards.text:
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
{W}{W}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavorText: Kytheon and his irregulars worked outside the law to bring justice to the streets of Akros.

rulings.text: Renown won’t trigger when a creature deals combat damage to a planeswalker or another creature. It also won’t trigger when a creature deals noncombat damage to a player.
If a creature with renown deals combat damage to its controller because that damage was redirected, renown will trigger.

If a renown ability triggers, but the creature leaves the battlefield before that ability resolves, the creature doesn’t become renowned. Any ability that triggers “whenever a creature becomes renowned” won’t trigger.

cards.name: Mighty Leap
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: "I feel the presence of the God-Pharaoh in the Second Sun, and I rise upon its rays."

rulings.text: Giving a creature flying after it’s already been blocked won’t change or undo that block. If you want to affect what can block the creature, you must cast Mighty Leap during the declare attackers step at the latest.

cards.name: Patron of the Valiant
cards.text:
Flying
When Patron of the Valiant enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavorText: "Bant's most gallant knights wear my sigil, and for that I am humbled."

cards.name: Relief Captain
cards.text: When Relief Captain enters the battlefield, support 3. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to three other target creatures.)
cards.flavorText: Sometimes gestures of support are small. Sometimes not.

rulings.text: You can’t put more than one +1/+1 counter on any one target using the support action.
Support can target a creature you don’t control.
If a spell with support has other abilities that target creatures, those abilities and the support ability can target the same creature.

cards.name: Steppe Glider
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
{1}{W}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains flying and vigilance until end of turn.

cards.name: Take Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavorText: "Your death will be a balm, your passing a welcome revision, and all will sigh with peace to know of your demise."

cards.name: Topan Freeblade
cards.text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
cards.flavorText: "My scars are my sigils. I will wear them with pride long after you're gone."

rulings.text: Renown won’t trigger when a creature deals combat damage to a planeswalker or another creature. It also won’t trigger when a creature deals noncombat damage to a player.
If a creature with renown deals combat damage to its controller because that damage was redirected, renown will trigger.

If a renown ability triggers, but the creature leaves the battlefield before that ability resolves, the creature doesn’t become renowned. Any ability that triggers “whenever a creature becomes renowned” won’t trigger.

cards.name: Zetalpa, Primal Dawn
cards.text: Flying, double strike, vigilance, trample, indestructible
cards.flavorText: The sky takes flight and the earth trembles.

rulings.text: If an attacking creature with double strike and trample destroys all of its blocking creatures with first-strike combat damage, all of its normal combat damage is assigned to the player or planeswalker that creature’s attacking.

cards.name: Aven Wind Mage
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Aven Wind Mage gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: "My skill sharpens with each beat of my wings."

rulings.text: Aven Wind Mage’s triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. It resolves even if that spell is countered.

cards.name: Claustrophobia
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Claustrophobia enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.flavorText: Six feet of earth muffled his cries.

rulings.text: Claustrophobia can target and enchant a tapped or untapped creature.
The enchanted creature can still be untapped in other ways. Claustrophobia will remain attached, and the creature will continue to not untap during its controller’s untap step.

cards.name: Cryptic Serpent
cards.text: This spell costs {1} less to cast for each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard.
cards.flavorText: It slithers through the senses, constricting consciousness and poisoning perceptions.

rulings.text: Cryptic Serpent’s ability doesn’t change its mana cost or converted mana cost. It just reduces the cost to cast the spell.
A split card only counts once for Cryptic Serpent’s ability, even if it’s both an instant and a sorcery.
Cryptic Serpent’s ability can’t reduce its cost to less than {U}{U}.

cards.name: Decision Paralysis
cards.text: Tap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
cards.flavorText:
"Eyes see only what is possible. A trained mind can explore the impossible."
—Kefnet, god of knowledge

cards.name: Dramatic Reversal
cards.text: Untap all nonland permanents you control.
cards.flavorText:
"Nobody asked you to butt in, Jace. But thanks."
—Chandra Nalaar

cards.name: Engulf the Shore
cards.text: Return to their owners' hands all creatures with toughness less than or equal to the number of Islands you control.
cards.flavorText:
"The tides have begun to ignore the moon."
—Tamiyo's journal

cards.name: Galestrike
cards.text:
Return target tapped creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavorText: Strong wings make strong winds.

rulings.text: If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Galestrike tries to resolve, the spell doesn’t resolve. You don’t draw a card.

cards.name: Rise from the Tides
cards.text: Create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token for each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard.
cards.flavorText:
"Dear brother, it's sweet that you have chosen to share your toys with Ludevic, but I too have found some new playmates."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa

rulings.text: Rise from the Tides is still on the stack while you count the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard. It doesn’t count itself.

cards.name: River's Rebuke
cards.text: Return all nonland permanents target player controls to their owner's hand.
cards.flavorText: Carefully following the thaumatic compass Bolas had given her, Vraska blundered straight into the River Heralds' trap.

rulings.text: There are many important moments in the story, but the most crucial—called “story spotlights”—are shown on cards. These cards have the Planeswalker symbol in their text box; this symbol has no effect on gameplay. You can read more about these events in the official Magic fiction at http://www.mtgstory.com.

cards.name: Salvager of Secrets
cards.text: When Salvager of Secrets enters the battlefield, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavorText: The greatest treasure of the deep is an echo from above.

cards.name: Accursed Horde
cards.text: {1}{B}: Target attacking Zombie gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. If its toughness is 0 or less, it's still put into its owner's graveyard.)

rulings.text: Accursed Horde’s ability can target itself while it’s attacking.
The target Zombie gains indestructible for the rest of the turn, even after it stops being an attacking creature.

cards.name: Carrion Screecher
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavorText: The banished have come home to roost.

cards.name: Crow of Dark Tidings
cards.text:
Flying
When Crow of Dark Tidings enters the battlefield or dies, mill two cards. (Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.)

rulings.text: The triggered ability triggers both when Crow of Dark Tidings enters the battlefield and when it dies. You don’t have to choose only one.

cards.name: Gavony Unhallowed
cards.text: Whenever another creature you control dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Gavony Unhallowed.
cards.flavorText:
"We entered the church in search of solace, but it became clear we wouldn't find it there."
—Grete, Order of Saint Traft

rulings.text: If Gavony Unhallowed and another creature you control die simultaneously (perhaps because they were both attacking or blocking), Gavony Unhallowed won’t be on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves. It can’t be saved by the +1/+1 counter that would have been put on it.

cards.name: Grasp of Darkness
cards.text: Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText:
"I welcome the use of even the foulest magic if it will rid us of the monstrosities that plague our world."
—Munda, ambush leader

cards.name: Liliana's Mastery
cards.text:
Zombies you control get +1/+1.
When Liliana's Mastery enters the battlefield, create two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens.
cards.flavorText: "There are so many of them. It seems they've just been waiting for someone to serve."

cards.name: Lord of the Accursed
cards.text:
Other Zombies you control get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: All Zombies gain menace until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: The Curse of Wandering leaves only hatred.

cards.name: Rise from the Grave
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.
cards.flavorText:
"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess

rulings.text: Rise from the Grave doesn’t overwrite any previous colors or types. Rather, it adds another color and another subtype.
If the creature is normally colorless, it will simply become black. It can’t be both black and colorless.

A later effect that changes the affected creature’s colors will overwrite that part of Rise from the Grave’s effect; the creature will be only the new color. The same is true about an effect that changes the affected creature’s types or subtypes.

cards.name: Tattered Mummy
cards.text: When Tattered Mummy dies, each opponent loses 2 life.
cards.flavorText: The dead who wander beyond the safety of the city crave only to spread their curse.

rulings.text: If your life total is brought to 0 or less at the same time that Tattered Mummy is dealt lethal damage, you lose the game before its triggered ability goes on the stack.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, the triggered ability of Tattered Mummy causes the opposing team to lose 4 life.

cards.name: Torgaar, Famine Incarnate
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This spell costs {2} less to cast for each creature sacrificed this way.
When Torgaar, Famine Incarnate enters the battlefield, up to one target player's life total becomes half their starting life total, rounded down.

rulings.text: Torgaar’s first ability can’t reduce its cost below {B}{B}. You can sacrifice any number of creatures, even if they won’t reduce Torgaar’s cost any further.

For your life total to become half your starting life total (normally 10, half of 20), you gain or lose the appropriate amount of life. For example, if your life total is 4 when Torgaar’s ability resolves targeting you, it will cause you to gain 6 life; alternatively, if your life total is 25 when it resolves, it will cause you to lose 15 life. Other cards that interact with life gain or life loss will interact with this effect accordingly.

In a Two-Headed Giant game, Torgaar’s ability causes the team’s life total to become half the team’s starting life total (normally 15, half of 30), but only the target player actually gains or loses life.

cards.name: Akoum Hellkite
cards.text:
Flying
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Akoum Hellkite deals 1 damage to any target. If that land is a Mountain, Akoum Hellkite deals 2 damage instead.

rulings.text: A landfall ability triggers whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control for any reason. It triggers whenever you play a land, as well as whenever a spell or ability puts a land onto the battlefield under your control.

When a land enters the battlefield under your control, each landfall ability of the permanents you control will trigger. You can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one to resolve.

If the ability has an additional or replacement effect that depends on the land having a certain basic land type, the ability will check that land’s type as the ability resolves. If, at that time, the land that entered the battlefield is no longer on the battlefield, use its types when it left the battlefield to determine what happens.

cards.name: Brute Strength
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: It's not the size of the rock. It's how badly you want to lift it.

cards.name: Destructive Tampering
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
cards.flavorText:
"I don't think they'll appreciate my . . . adjustments."
—Karavin, renegade saboteur

rulings.text: Because the effect of Destructive Tampering’s second mode doesn’t change the characteristics of any permanents, the set of creatures affected by it is constantly updated. Creatures without flying that enter the battlefield later in the turn won’t be able to block.

cards.name: Dragon Egg
cards.text:
Defender
When Dragon Egg dies, create a 2/2 red Dragon creature token with flying and "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
cards.flavorText: Dragon birth lairs are littered with treasure to entice the young from their eggs.

cards.name: Kargan Dragonrider
cards.text: As long as you control a Dragon, Kargan Dragonrider has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavorText: "Only those who give the dragons the respect they deserve may bear our title."

cards.name: Lathliss, Dragon Queen
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever another nontoken Dragon enters the battlefield under your control, create a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying.
{1}{R}: Dragons you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lightning Strike
cards.text: Lightning Strike deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavorText: To wield lightning is to tame chaos.

cards.name: Sparktongue Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Sparktongue Dragon enters the battlefield, you may pay {2}{R}. When you do, it deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavorText: Fools believe that Kolaghan's brood follows lightning storms. The wise know that it is the other way around.

rulings.text: Sparktongue Dragon’s triggered ability goes on the stack without a target. While that ability is resolving, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, a second ability triggers and you pick a target that will be dealt damage. This is different from abilities that say “If you do . . .” in that players may cast spells and activate abilities after mana is paid but before damage is dealt.
While resolving the triggered ability of Sparktongue Dragon, you can’t pay {2}{R} multiple times to have it deal more than 3 damage.

cards.name: Voldaren Duelist
cards.text:
Haste
When Voldaren Duelist enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavorText: "I have yet to find my equal."

cards.name: Zealot of the God-Pharaoh
cards.text: {4}{R}: Zealot of the God-Pharaoh deals 2 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
cards.flavorText: The God-Pharaoh's most devoted took it upon themselves to follow his example.

cards.name: Crested Herdcaller
cards.text:
Trample
When Crested Herdcaller enters the battlefield, create a 3/3 green Dinosaur creature token with trample.
cards.flavorText:
"Our survival, like theirs, depends on our ability to work together."
—Huatli, to Tishana

cards.name: Ghalta, Primal Hunger
cards.text:
This spell costs {X} less to cast, where X is the total power of creatures you control.
Trample
cards.flavorText: The earth walks, strongest of all.

rulings.text: To determine Ghalta’s total cost, start with the mana cost (or an alternative cost if another card’s effect allows you to pay one instead), add any cost increases, then apply any cost reductions. Ghalta’s converted mana cost remains unchanged, no matter what the total cost to cast it was.

The total cost to cast Ghalta is locked in before you pay that cost. For example, if you control three 2/2 creatures, including one you can sacrifice to add {C} to your mana pool, the total cost of Ghalta is {4}{G}{G}. Then you can sacrifice the creature when you activate mana abilities just before paying the cost.
If a creature’s power is somehow less than 0, it subtracts from the total power of your other creatures. If the total power of your creatures is 0 or less, Ghalta’s cost remains {10}{G}{G}.
Ghalta’s first ability can’t reduce its cost below {G}{G}.

cards.name: Grazing Whiptail
cards.text: Reach
cards.flavorText: Often found browsing on the upper canopies of Ixalan's jungles, whiptails are known to absently bat away anything foolish enough to interrupt their meal.

cards.name: Ranging Raptors
cards.text: Enrage — Whenever Ranging Raptors is dealt damage, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
cards.flavorText: They cover their territory like a tide of teeth and claws.

rulings.text: If multiple sources deal damage to a creature with an enrage ability at the same time, most likely because multiple creatures blocked that creature, the enrage ability triggers only once.

If lethal damage is dealt to a creature with an enrage ability, that ability triggers. The creature with that enrage ability leaves the battlefield before that ability resolves, so it won’t be affected by the resolving ability.

cards.name: Ripjaw Raptor
cards.text: Enrage — Whenever Ripjaw Raptor is dealt damage, draw a card.
cards.flavorText: Raptors are clever enough to tear away a hard metal shell to get at the tasty morsel inside.

rulings.text: If multiple sources deal damage to a creature with an enrage ability at the same time, most likely because multiple creatures blocked that creature, the enrage ability triggers only once.

If lethal damage is dealt to a creature with an enrage ability, that ability triggers. The creature with that enrage ability leaves the battlefield before that ability resolves, so it won’t be affected by the resolving ability.

cards.name: Spidery Grasp
cards.text: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+4 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavorText:
"Nobody's seen the Lady of Videns for years. Poor dear, no companions at all in that old castle."
—Yonda of Gavony

rulings.text: Spidery Grasp can target a creature that’s already untapped. It will still get +2/+4 and gain reach.

cards.name: Thunderherd Migration
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, reveal a Dinosaur card from your hand or pay {1}.
Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
cards.flavorText: The herds follow as new growth arises.

rulings.text: If an effect refers to a “[subtype] spell” or “[subtype] card,” it refers only to a spell or card that has that subtype. For example, March of the Drowned is a card that benefits Pirates and features Pirates in its illustration, but it isn’t a Pirate card.

cards.name: Thundering Spineback
cards.text:
Other Dinosaurs you control get +1/+1.
{5}{G}: Create a 3/3 green Dinosaur creature token with trample.
cards.flavorText:
"It appears that nature has risen against us."
—Captain Brinely Rage

cards.name: Howling Golem
cards.text: Whenever Howling Golem attacks or blocks, each player draws a card.
cards.flavorText: It wails of buried riches and the souls lost seeking them.

rulings.text: After Howling Golem’s triggered ability resolves, players can cast spells and activate abilities before blockers are declared if it’s attacking, or before damage is dealt if it’s blocking.

tokens.name: Dragon
tokens.text:
Flying
{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

tokens.name: Dinosaur
tokens.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
